 {'penalty': 'l2', 'C': 0.048939009184774937} 
 0.747858672377
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [31]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Creating new models</span>
<span class="n">clf_over_smpld_accur_l1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l1'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.52983</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_over_smpld_accur_l2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l2'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.20436</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">clf_over_smpld_recall_l1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l1'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.00042</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_over_smpld_recall_l2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l2'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.04894</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#Fitting models</span>
<span class="n">clf_over_smpld_accur_l1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_over_smpld_accur_l2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">clf_over_smpld_recall_l1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_over_smpld_recall_l2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Summary of precision-recall metric for all models</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">Oversampled precision-recall metrics</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Accuracy Optimized Logistic Regression</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"l1"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_over_smpld_accur_l1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_os</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"l2"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_over_smpld_accur_l2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_os</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Recall Optimized Logistic Regression</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"l1"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_over_smpld_recall_l1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_os</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"l2"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_over_smpld_recall_l2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_os</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_os</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can see that oversampling performed slightly better than undersampling in improving the recall score for the minority class of the dataset. This could be because the oversampling technique narrowed the distribution of the minority class, making it easier to train a model that could identify it. Future work will need to compare different oversampling techniques to improve model performance.</p>
<h2 id="Scaling-and-Comparing-Results">Scaling and Comparing Results<a class="anchor-link" href="#Scaling-and-Comparing-Results">¶</a></h2><p>I'll implement scaling with under and over-sampling methods at once, only optimizing for recall in all of the cases, and compare the results afterwards.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [32]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Scaling X and comparing results</span>
<span class="n">X2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">X</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">())</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">X</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1"># Undersampling with imblearn</span>
<span class="n">rus</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">RandomUnderSampler</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">random_state</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ratio</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">1.0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">X_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_us2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">rus</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit_sample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Creating training/testing split for undersampled dataset</span>
<span class="n">X_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">X_test_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_test_us2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">train_test_split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">test_size</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.20</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">random_state</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                                    <span class="n">stratify</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">Y_us2</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># GridsearchCV</span>
<span class="n">parameters_l1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'penalty'</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="s1">'l1'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'C'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">30</span><span class="p">)}</span>
<span class="n">parameters_l2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'penalty'</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="s1">'l2'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'C'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">30</span><span class="p">)}</span>

<span class="n">scores</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'accuracy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'recall'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="c1"># out of the box logistic regression</span>
<span class="n">clf_smpld</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">clf_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us2</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">score</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">scores</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"# Tuning hyper-parameters for l1 </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">GridSearchCV</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">parameters_l1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cv</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                           <span class="n">scoring</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us2</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_estimator_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_params_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_score_</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"# Tuning hyper-parameters for l2 </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">GridSearchCV</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">parameters_l2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cv</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                           <span class="n">scoring</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us2</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_estimator_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_params_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_under_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_score_</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [33]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Creating new models</span>
<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_accur_l1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l1'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.32903</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_accur_l2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l2'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.000417</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_recall_l1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l1'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">100.0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_recall_l2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">LogisticRegression</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">penalty</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'l2'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">C</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.0001</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Fitting the models</span>
<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_accur_l1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us2</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_accur_l2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us2</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_recall_l1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us2</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">clf_under_smpld_recall_l2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us2</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Summary of precision-recall metric for all models</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">Undersampled precision-recall metrics</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">Precision-Recall Metrics of Non-Optimized Logistic Regression</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us2</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_us2</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Accuracy Optimized Logistic Regression</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"l1"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_under_smpld_accur_l1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us2</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_us2</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"l2"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_under_smpld_accur_l2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us2</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_us2</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Recall Optimized Logistic Regression</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"l1"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_under_smpld_recall_l1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us2</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_us2</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"l2"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">classification_report</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y_test_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">clf_under_smpld_recall_l2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_us2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_us2</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_test_us2</span><span class="p">),</span>
                            <span class="n">target_names</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">target_names</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>

<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Smote oversampling</span>
<span class="n">sm</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">SMOTE</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">random_state</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ratio</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1.0</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># ratio = 1 means equal classes. This can be tweaked.</span>
<span class="n">X_os2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_os2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sm</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit_sample</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Creating training/testing split for undersampled dataset</span>
<span class="n">X_train_os2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">X_test_os2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_test_os2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">train_test_split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_os2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_os2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">test_size</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.20</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">random_state</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span>
                                                <span class="n">stratify</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">Y_os2</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># GridsearchCV</span>
<span class="n">parameters_l1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'penalty'</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="s1">'l1'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'C'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">30</span><span class="p">)}</span>
<span class="n">parameters_l2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'penalty'</span><span class="p">:[</span><span class="s1">'l2'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'C'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">logspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">30</span><span class="p">)}</span>

<span class="n">scores</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'accuracy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'recall'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">score</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">scores</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"# Tuning hyper-parameters for l1 </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">GridSearchCV</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">parameters_l1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cv</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                           <span class="n">scoring</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_os2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os2</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_estimator_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_params_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_score_</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"# Tuning hyper-parameters for l2 </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">"</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="n">score</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">""</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">GridSearchCV</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">parameters_l2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cv</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span>

    <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_train_os2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y_train_os2</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_estimator_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_params_</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">,</span>
          <span class="n">clf_opt_over_smpld</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">best_score_</span><span class="p">)</span>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Comparison-Between-Scaled-and-Original-Data">Comparison Between Scaled and Original Data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Comparison-Between-Scaled-and-Original-Data">¶</a></h1><p>Scaling the variables before training a model seems to normalize the results between L1 and L2 regularization. Generally, all of the models that were scaled performed better at increasing precision while most of the models from the original dataset (all except one) returned a higher recall metric than the scaled models. Since we are trying to maximize the recall for the default class (Y=1), I will continue with the non-scaled models.</p>
<p>Something to think about for the future is assessing what the cost of a false positive is in this case. For example, if someone is labeled as liable to default but does not, how will that affect the bank? This is a common question in large-scale manufacturing, where processes cannot be halted simply because a part might be defective, as that down-time costs the company a great deal of money.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="7.-Conclusions-&-Summary-of-Findings">7. Conclusions & Summary of Findings<a class="anchor-link" href="#7.-Conclusions-&-Summary-of-Findings">¶</a></h1><p>The original goal of this project was to assess the dataset and create a classification model that would maximize the number of default customers predicted. In the process of examining the data, I discovered an imbalance in the response variable that provided problems in predicting for the minority class of data, default customers who I wanted to predict would default on their next payment.</p>
<p>To remedy this case of class imbalance, where about 20% of the response lay within the minority class and the rest in the majority class, I employed resampling techniques to adjust the ratio of minority class to majority class. The undersampling algorithm I used took random samples from the majority class to match the number of samples in the minority class. The oversampling algorithm is known as SMOTE and is a sophisticated method of creating new minority measurements, but has its drawbacks. Both under and over-sampling return improved modeling results for this imbalanced dataset by improving the recall of the minority class.</p>
<p>I then scaled the data by subtracting the mean amount from each column and dividing by the standard deviation. After scaling, I employed both resampling techniques and optimized for recall, since that clearly returned the maximum recall score for the minority class. The results showed an overall increased precision values for all of the models and for both resampling techniques, but the recall for the minority class stagnated around a value of 0.60, where a value of 0.75 was achieved with non-scaled and oversampled L2 logistic regression. While there are costs associated with lower precision, it is up to the user and model-builder to determine how many false positives are acceptable for the application in question.</p>
<p>To improve models, here are the steps that I would take:</p>
<ol>
<li>Use the current process to compare to different algorithms, such as Naive Bayes, KNN, discriminant bayes, and neural networks.</li>
<li>Adjust the classification threshold. Instead of making 50% probability of default, I could shift that threshold up and down to adjust recall and precision rates. In practice, this is useful as precision cannot be ignored, as there are also costs associated with lower precision rates.</li>
<li>Adjust the resampling techniques. The package Imblearn provides many different options for undersampling and oversampling, of which I can experiment with new methods to improve precision and recall rates. Do this step in combination with the previous steps.</li>
</ol>
<h2 id="Comparison-to-Parent-Study">Comparison to Parent Study<a class="anchor-link" href="#Comparison-to-Parent-Study">¶</a></h2><p>This project dove into the details of resampling techniques and how they can benefit classification algorithms. I focused on logistic regression models and two resampling techniques to thoroughly examine the benefits of optimizing for accuracy and recall, as well as observing the effect that resampling had on improving model performance. With the process in place for imbalanced data, I can then compare models that have employed resampling and to models that do not need to resample, such as random forest or CART models.</p>
<p>The authors of the original paper focused on predicting the actual probability of default by employing a novel measurement technique. To measure the accuracy of their prediction models, they used a gains chart to measure the increase in prediction capability for each model they used. They used the ratio of the area under the predictive model divided by the area under a perfect model to return a single number for model accuracy. However, this study did not employ resampling methods to improve model performance, as the main goal of their paper was to assess a novel method for assessing the real probability of default.</p>
<p>Since the authors did not use resampling techniques to improve their models, it would be interesting to compare results with updated model predictions. While lift charts are not directly linked to recall, it would be interesting to see how our results compare. Due to time constraints, I will leave construction of lift charts and comparison to the parent paper's results for future work.</p>
<p>This project showed steps on how to deal with imbalanced data and observed improved recall rates for both L1 and L2 regularized logistic regression when resampling was employed. Oversampling performed slightly better than undersampling for improving recall rates of the minority class. Future analysis will dive into why oversampling did better in this case and what other resampling techniques might improve model performance for this particular dataset.</p>
</div>
